com.vanillasource.aio

Interface AioLeader

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ReadableByteChannelLeader, WritableByteChannelLeader
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    UncontrollableByteArrayReadableByteChannelLeader, UncontrollableByteArrayWritableByteChannelLeader, UncontrollableReadableByteChannelLeader

    public interface AioLeader
extends AutoCloseable
    An AIO (Asynchronous-IO) Leader represents a peer in an AIO communication which drives the conversation. A leader may be either producing or consuming data. Its key attribute is that it drives the conversation, essentially owns the Thread the communication is executed in. The follower may ask the Leader to pause or resume the conversation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Instructs the leader to stop all I/O, and free all resources.
      void pause()
      Instructs the leader to temporarily pause the production or consumption of data.
      void resume()
      Instructs the leader to resume producing or consuming data.

    • Method Detail

      • pause

        void pause()
        Instructs the leader to temporarily pause the production or consumption of data. No events will be delivered after this call.

      • resume

        void resume()
        Instructs the leader to resume producing or consuming data.

      • close

        void close()
        Instructs the leader to stop all I/O, and free all resources.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
